intro: Piptomeris densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains one or two seeds. Piptomeris densiflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host species.
